Articles.Content: when i first got ksp i got 0.21 on the day i think it came and i never got a chance to play with the old buildings i knows there a old version of free ksp downloads but i would like 0.20 or 0.17 since i never got a chance to play with it is there anyway squad or take 2 can give a version of it or something else?

This is the 3rd thread i have seen asking the same question in a week.

Do you use the steam or store bought version?

On 11/26/2017 at 11:00 AM, NSEP said:

Do you use the steam or store bought version?

 

Steam only goes as far back as 1.0.5

i know i have copies of version 0.21 and 0.22 1.0.5 1.1.3 1.2.2 1.3.0 1.3.1 at minimum i'd like 0.16 i have been playing the game for 4 years almost 5 and id love to play 0.16 or 0.17 etc and i know there's a forum for old versions up to 0.13

@Jim123 I don't believe what you're asking for has ever been made available. At least I'm not aware of any time that Squad has made any version newer than 0.13 available other than the current version and a rollback version or two.

It's not the same exact thing, of course, but if you really want to get a small sample of the environment from 0.18.3 (I think that's the correct number?) you can try to track down the old Demo version that is said to still be kicking around out there in the wild. There's threads about that.

Perhaps there's some merits to going back to see how far KSP has come, but despite archiving every version since I bought the game I have yet to feel a desire to go back. I feel like a crazy person for saving it all, but before 1.0 KSP always felt like it was walking a fine line between success and a this-update-is-the-last-update post from the devs. It felt like the right thing to do at the time (and it doesn't take up that much space).

0.7.3 is the earliest you can get

Edited November 28, 2017 by Galileo

6 hours ago, Galileo said:

0.7.3 is the earliest you can get

That does not go up to 0.17/16 like he was asking for:

11 hours ago, Jim123 said:

i know i have copies of version 0.21 and 0.22 1.0.5 1.1.3 1.2.2 1.3.0 1.3.1 at minimum i'd like 0.16 i have been playing the game for 4 years almost 5 and id love to play 0.16 or 0.17 etc and i know there's a forum for old versions up to 0.13 

 

Everything after 0.13 wasn't free anymore so it might be hard updates after that.
is there anyway i could trade a version with squad or someone who already owns the game i have 0.21 and 0.22

I think you'd have to ask Squad directly, and provide proof of purchase etc. but tbh I wouldn't expect them to want to give out old versions because if they do it for one person they'd have to do it for everyone and that might give the impression that they would provide support for the old versions and well... can. worms. open. everywhere. 
But I'd ask anyway, you never know, and it's better than asking the community cos even though some of us do have the old versions, we honour Squads choice not to include DRM by strictly adhering to the rules of not giving copies to anyone. 

 

12 hours ago, Mako said:

but despite archiving every version since I bought the game I have yet to feel a desire to go back. I feel like a crazy person for saving it all

I too have questioned my sanity about this, but I've come to accept that I am a data hoarder, so I religiously keep archiving each version.  I've only gone back to an archived version once and that was just so I could remove a part that no longer existed or had been renamed from a craft so I could move it into a newer version.  And being able to do that was enough to self-justify my lunacy.

2 hours ago, Jim123 said:

is there anyway i could trade a version with squad or someone who already owns the game i have 0.21 and 0.22 

There is no legal way to trade or give copies of the software to others. Take-Two could give you what you're asking for since they now own KSP, but I doubt you're going to find a representative from Take-Two here to ask. Also, it would depend of if Squad has archived old build versions in the same crazy way some of us users have.

Edit: I meant to add that even mentioning trading or giving this software to other people or otherwise obtaining versions that are not officially available is not allowed on these forums and often results in threads getting closed. I'm not a mod, but I figured I'd put this info here in case anyone was unaware.

Edited November 28, 2017 by Mako
how do i ask squad directly

I believe they have a website, https://kerbalspaceprogram.com

Click the support tab and they have several emails.

well ive contacted them and sent a message so i'll see. thanks for the help .

i can not tell if the kerbal emoji is smiling or frowning no offense made is he's frowning i thought i hit the right button

13 hours ago, Jim123 said:

is there anyway i could trade a version with squad or someone who already owns the game i have 0.21 and 0.22 

I'm sorry, but no. Trading versions is illegal due to the copyright laws governing software.
i know i just found out i got a message well consider this topic or forum post dead or closed
Closed by OP's request.
